lead_paragraph: COTTY--Edmond, 92, died December 28 at his home in Scarsdale, NY. Son of Gustave Cotty and Marie Parisod, he earned his MBA from the University of Lausanne, Switzerland. There he met his wife, Yvette Mina Chuard. He emigrated to New York City in 1948 to join the investment firm of Istel, Lepercq & Co. He went on to be president of John Bristol & Co. (1964) and founder of Cotty, Feldman & Co. (1971) which merged with New Court Securities/Rothschild, Inc. (1974) where he directed their Investment Management Division until his retirement (1993). He was very active in the Scarsdale Congregational Church. He is predeceased by his beloved wife of 57 years, Yvette, and by his treasured daughter, Isabelle Cotty. He is survived by his daughter Anne-Claude Cotty and son Phil Cotty. A celebration of his life will be held on Saturday, January 9 at 11am at the Scarsdale Congregational Church, 1 Heathcote Road, Scarsdale, NY. Donations may be made in his honor to White Plains Hospital or Scarsdale Volunteer Ambulance. 1/3
